<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial"></a>

# ProceduralSkyMaterial

**Inherits:** [Material](Material.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A material that defines a simple sky for a [Sky](Sky.md) resource.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**ProceduralSkyMaterial** provides a way to create an effective background quickly by defining procedural parameters for the sun, the sky and the ground. The sky and ground are defined by a main color, a color at the horizon, and an easing curve to interpolate between them. Suns are described by a position in the sky, a color, and a max angle from the sun at which the easing curve ends. The max angle therefore defines the size of the sun in the sky.

\ **ProceduralSkyMaterial** supports up to 4 suns, using the color, and energy, direction, and angular distance of the first four [DirectionalLight3D](DirectionalLight3D.md) nodes in the scene. This means that the suns are defined individually by the properties of their corresponding [DirectionalLight3D](DirectionalLight3D.md)\\ s and globally by [sun_angle_max](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sun_angle_max) and [sun_curve](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sun_curve).

\ **ProceduralSkyMaterial** uses a lightweight shader to draw the sky and is therefore suited for real-time updates. This makes it a great option for a sky that is simple and computationally cheap, but unrealistic. If you need a more realistic procedural option, use [PhysicalSkyMaterial](PhysicalSkyMaterial.md).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_energy_multiplier"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **energy_multiplier** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_energy_multiplier)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_energy_multiplier**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_energy_multiplier**\ (\ )

The sky's overall brightness multiplier. Higher values result in a brighter sky.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_bottom_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **ground_bottom_color** = `Color(0.2, 0.169, 0.133, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_bottom_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_ground_bottom_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_ground_bottom_color**\ (\ )

Color of the ground at the bottom. Blends with [ground_horizon_color](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_horizon_color).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_curve"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **ground_curve** = `0.02` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_curve)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_ground_curve**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_ground_curve**\ (\ )

How quickly the [ground_horizon_color](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_horizon_color) fades into the [ground_bottom_color](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_bottom_color).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_energy_multiplier"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **ground_energy_multiplier** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_energy_multiplier)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_ground_energy_multiplier**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_ground_energy_multiplier**\ (\ )

Multiplier for ground color. A higher value will make the ground brighter.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_horizon_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **ground_horizon_color** = `Color(0.6463, 0.6558, 0.6708, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_horizon_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_ground_horizon_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_ground_horizon_color**\ (\ )

Color of the ground at the horizon. Blends with [ground_bottom_color](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_ground_bottom_color).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_cover"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **sky_cover** [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_cover)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sky_cover**\ (\ value\: [Texture2D](Texture2D.md)\ )
- [Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **get_sky_cover**\ (\ )

The sky cover texture to use. This texture must use an equirectangular projection (similar to [PanoramaSkyMaterial](PanoramaSkyMaterial.md)). The texture's colors will be *added* to the existing sky color, and will be multiplied by [sky_energy_multiplier](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_energy_multiplier) and [sky_cover_modulate](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_cover_modulate). This is mainly suited to displaying stars at night, but it can also be used to display clouds at day or night (with a non-physically-accurate look).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_cover_modulate"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **sky_cover_modulate** = `Color(1, 1, 1, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_cover_modulate)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sky_cover_modulate**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_sky_cover_modulate**\ (\ )

The tint to apply to the [sky_cover](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_cover) texture. This can be used to change the sky cover's colors or opacity independently of the sky energy, which is useful for day/night or weather transitions. Only effective if a texture is defined in [sky_cover](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_cover).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_curve"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **sky_curve** = `0.15` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_curve)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sky_curve**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_sky_curve**\ (\ )

How quickly the [sky_horizon_color](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_horizon_color) fades into the [sky_top_color](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_top_color).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_energy_multiplier"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **sky_energy_multiplier** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_energy_multiplier)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sky_energy_multiplier**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_sky_energy_multiplier**\ (\ )

Multiplier for sky color. A higher value will make the sky brighter.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_horizon_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **sky_horizon_color** = `Color(0.6463, 0.6558, 0.6708, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_horizon_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sky_horizon_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_sky_horizon_color**\ (\ )

Color of the sky at the horizon. Blends with [sky_top_color](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_top_color).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_top_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **sky_top_color** = `Color(0.385, 0.454, 0.55, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_top_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sky_top_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_sky_top_color**\ (\ )

Color of the sky at the top. Blends with [sky_horizon_color](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sky_horizon_color).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sun_angle_max"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **sun_angle_max** = `30.0` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sun_angle_max)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sun_angle_max**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_sun_angle_max**\ (\ )

Distance from center of sun where it fades out completely.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sun_curve"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **sun_curve** = `0.15` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sun_curve)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sun_curve**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_sun_curve**\ (\ )

How quickly the sun fades away between the edge of the sun disk and [sun_angle_max](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_sun_angle_max).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_use_debanding"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **use_debanding** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#ProceduralSkyMaterial_property_use_debanding)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_use_debanding**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_use_debanding**\ (\ )

If ``true``, enables debanding. Debanding adds a small amount of noise which helps reduce banding that appears from the smooth changes in color in the sky.
